dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 4562 IH: Sustainable Aviation Fuel Information Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Flood (for himself and Mr. Carter of Louisiana) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To make publicly available information on sustainable aviation fuel production and imports, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Sustainable Aviation Fuel Information Act.

subsection.text: As soon as practicable after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary of Energy, acting through the Administrator of the Energy Information Administration, shall include in each report titled Petroleum Supply Monthly of the Energy Information Administration, each report titled Weekly Petroleum Status Report of the Energy Information Administration, and any other relevant report of the Energy Information Administration, as determined by the Administrator of the Energy Information Administration, data on sustainable aviation fuel, including—

paragraph.text: the type, origin, and volume of feedstock used in the production of sustainable aviation fuel—

subparagraph.text: in each State or, if appropriate, Petroleum Administration for Defense District, as applicable;
to the maximum extent practicable, in each foreign country, as applicable; and

paragraph.text: the total amount of sustainable aviation fuel—

clause.text: in each State, as applicable; and
each foreign country, as applicable; and

subsection.text: Data published pursuant to this section shall be obtained using an accounting methodology that—

paragraph.text: is consistent with reliable statistical sampling techniques; and
ensures no double counting of feedstock or fuel.

subsection.text: Nothing in this section affects the applicability of section 205 of the Department of Energy Organization Act (42 U.S.C. 7135).

section.text: In this Act, the term sustainable aviation fuel has the meaning given such term in section 40B(d) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986.
